pullRequest.body:
Introduces diffeological spaces, smooth maps between them, the D-topology and the standard diffeology on finite-dimensional normed spaces.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
This is the first of hopefully many PRs upstreaming work that I have done on diffeological spaces in [my orbifolds repo](https://github.com/peabrainiac/lean-orbifolds), containing the first half of `Diffeology/Basic.lean`.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [700f2f4fd8](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21969/commits/700f2f4fd869d7fac067f18019ea75eef7d9a99a)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Geometry.Diffeology.Basic` (new file)|1985|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ContDiff.dsmooth`
`+ ContDiff.isPlot`
`+ DSmooth`
`+ DSmooth.comp`
`+ DSmooth.comp'`
`+ DSmooth.contDiff`
`+ DSmooth.continuous`
`+ DSmooth.continuous'`
`+ DSmooth.isPlot`
`+ DTop`
`+ DiffeologicalSpace`
`+ DiffeologicalSpace.CorePlotsOn`
`+ DiffeologicalSpace.ext`
`+ DiffeologicalSpace.mkOfPlotsOn`
`+ DiffeologicalSpace.withDTopology`
`+ DiffeologicalSpace.withDTopology_eq`
`+ Eucl`
`+ IsContDiffCompatible`
`+ IsDTopCompatible`
`+ IsPlot`
`+ IsPlot.contDiff`
`+ IsPlot.continuous`
`+ IsPlot.dsmooth`
`+ IsPlot.dsmooth_comp`
`+ IsPlot.dsmooth_comp'`
`+ because`
`+ contDiffCompatible_iff_eq_euclideanDiffeology`
`+ dTop_eq`
`+ dsmooth_const`
`+ dsmooth_id`
`+ dsmooth_id'`
`+ dsmooth_iff`
`+ dsmooth_iff_contDiff`
`+ euclideanDiffeology`
`+ instance - otherwise, there would be two TopologicalSpace-instances on binary products, the`
`+ instance : DiffeologicalSpace ℝ := euclideanDiffeology`
`+ instance {ι : Type*} [Fintype ι] : DiffeologicalSpace (EuclideanSpace ℝ ι)`
`+ isOpen_iff_preimages_plots`
`+ isPlot_const`
`+ isPlot_id`
`+ isPlot_id'`
`+ isPlot_iff_contDiff`
`+ isPlot_iff_dsmooth`
`+ isPlot_reparam`
`++ instance {X : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup X] [NormedSpace ℝ X]`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Just had a quick skim through the code now, the consensus is that `Prop` valued classes should start with `Is`. So I think it should be `IsDTopCompatible` , `IsContDiffCompatible`, not sure it should also be `IsDSmooth`. 

Anyway great job! I played around with your code few months back and I liked it! I'm looking forward to having derivative and tangent spaces in mathlib at some point.

> Just had a quick skim through the code now, the consensus is that `Prop` valued classes should start with `Is`. So I think it should be `IsDTopCompatible` , `IsContDiffCompatible`, not sure it should also be `IsDSmooth`.

I think you're right about prop-valued typeclasses, so I renamed them now. I'm less sure about `DSmooth` though - looking through mathlib, there are some function properties like `IsEmbedding` or `isInducing` that use `Is`, but also many others that don't, like `Continuous`, `Measurable`, `ContDiff`, `ContMDiff`, `Smooth` etc. Unless there is a clear consensus that they should be renamed I'd be more in favour of keeping `DSmooth` without an `Is` too.
Yes there are so many propositions on functions without `Is`, I would keep it as `DSmooth` as well.

Also you should be able to mark `IsPlot` with `fun_prop` as well as theorems like `isPlot_const`, `IsPlot.reparam`(this one might require reformulation as a lambda term),  `IsPlot.dsmooth`, `DSmooth.isPlot`, `ContDiff.dsmooth`, `DSmooth.contDiff`. 

`fun_prop` should be able to translate freely between `IsPlot`, `DSmooth` and `ContDiff`. If not then it is a bug and let me know.

I'm not sure about `DSmooth.continuous`, `IsPlot.continuous` but you can try.

> Also you should be able to mark `IsPlot` with `fun_prop` as well as theorems like `isPlot_const`, `IsPlot.reparam`(this one might require reformulation as a lambda term), `IsPlot.dsmooth`, `DSmooth.isPlot`, `ContDiff.dsmooth`, `DSmooth.contDiff`.
> 
> `fun_prop` should be able to translate freely between `IsPlot`, `DSmooth` and `ContDiff`. If not then it is a bug and let me know.

I've marked most of these with `fun_prop` now, as well as a few additional lemmas that seemed appropriate after reading through the documentation [here](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Tactic/FunProp.html), like `isPlot_id`. The one lemma I didn't add is `IsPlot.reparam`; it is less general than the lemma that `DSmooth f` and `IsPlot p` implies `IsPlot (f ∘ p)`, and I'm guessing that having both would be bad because then `fun_prop` might not know which of the two to use.

One thing I don't really understand yet is why reformulation as a lambda term is important. I've done this by introducing primed variants of lemmas analogous to `Continuous.comp'`, but when testing it didn't seem to matter whether I marked the primed or unprimed version, so I don't see why it's actually necessary.

> I'm not sure about `DSmooth.continuous`, `IsPlot.continuous` but you can try.

It does seem to work in the testing I have done (with the caveat of course that `fun_prop` can't guess e.g. the topology on the middle space when proving `Continuous (f ∘ g)`, so you still have to supply topology instances here and there), but I'm not sure if it's the unprimed or primed versions that should be marked, or both. I've marked none of them for now.

Apparently there's also a bit of a problem with the unused imports linter: it wants me to remove the `Mathlib.Tactic.FunProp.ContDiff` import, even though it is needed in order for `fun_prop` to recognise `IsPlot.contDiff` and `DSmooth.contDiff` correctly. I'm not quite sure what to do about that.

pullRequest.title: feat(Geometry/Diffeology): basics of diffeological spaces

source.title: feat(Geometry/Diffeology): diffeologies generated from sets of plots
